resources.string: These financial calculators will assist you in bringing your money under control and help it grow
This is the icon for going to Credit Card repayment preface
This is the icon for going to Emergency Fund preface
This is the icon for going to Compound Interest preface
This is the icon for going to Irregular Payments preface

Emergency Funds are a great way to ensure you do not run out of money if you temporarily lose a job, get sick or need some money for a replacement car. This doesn't replace a savings account, and you are not supposed to touch this until you are really in an emergency.

Paying off credit card debt is a geat step to being more financially secure. Make note of your interest rate and principal amount. The more you pay off the principal, the less interest you get charged.
Credit cards utilise compound interest to their advantage. You too can utilise compound interest. With this calculator, you will be able to see just how much your money can grow.

Irregular payments are often categorised as payments that happen once per year. It is common to forget that car registration is due at a particular part of the year. This calcuator helps you budget by taking the overall amount and breaking it down so you can budget the entire amount over the year instead of trying to find a lump sum once a year.
